summary: The Smoke Exposure Research Act of 2025 mandates the Agricultural Research Service to research the impact of wildfire smoke on wine grapes. This includes identifying harmful compounds, developing testing methodologies, establishing a database of background levels, creating risk assessment tools and mitigation methods, and studying barrier compounds. The bill authorizes $6,500,000 annually from 2026-2030 and mandates coordination with land-grant colleges in California, Oregon, and Washington.
